title: 12 Democrats square off in Ohio presidential debate: live blog
text:
Getty Images Democratic presidential candidates Sen. Bernie Sanders, former Vice President Joe Biden and Sen. Elizabeth Warren reunite Tuesday for a debate in Westerville, Ohio, along with nine other White House hopefuls.

Follow along with MarketWatch reporters for live analysis and updates of the fourth Democratic presidential debate, featuring top contenders Joe Biden and Elizabeth Warren and 10 other White House hopefuls.

Tonight’s action will be at Otterbein University in Westerville, Ohio, a northeast suburb of Columbus. The debate runs from 8 p.m. Eastern to 11 p.m. Eastern and is being co-hosted by CNN and the New York Times.

Key tickers: Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.89% | 10-year Treasury note TMUBMUSD10Y, +2.43% | U.S. dollar DXY, -0.15%.

Read: Democratic debate tonight features a surging Warren and a recuperating Sanders | Here are all the Democrats running for president, as a dozen get ready for tonight’s debate | Warren tops Biden in new poll on eve of Democratic debate.
